item.title: Turbo Thrust
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Any day I get Erika to draw some Destiny 2 fan art for me is a GOOD day. Today’s review is probably not the most in-depth, but I liked this toy enough to pass on my spare to a friend – it’s a real good cock sleeve – and I think it’s really doing something […]
item.content:encoded:
Turbo Thrust

by Matthew Nolan on 11/07/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

Any day I get Erika to draw some Destiny 2 fan art for me is a GOOD day.

Today’s review is probably not the most in-depth, but I liked this toy enough to pass on my spare to a friend – it’s a real good cock sleeve – and I think it’s really doing something new that actually feels good. A lot of other toys and companies are trying out new novelty things that end up just being superfluous but the Turbo Thrust isn’t one of them!

I don’t really know if you NEED this toy next to your bedside. Especially since Fleshlight has been re-releasing my most fav model, the Sex in a Can Anal model – which I super reccomend. Buttttt while the Turbo’s cost and size can be pretty crazy, if you’ve got some spare pocket money and a bigger than average cock, I think it’s a sure bet for a fun time.

I think Early to Bed’s description line says it all really: ‘Gah.. how gorgeous is this?’

item.title: Am I Ready For Sex?
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.category: HOW will it impact my life?
why do I want to have sex?
item.description: Haha, oh jeez, I’ve been avoiding this comic since we launched four years ago. “How do I know if I’m ready for sex?” (and variations of that question) is one of our most frequently requested topics and it’s… it’s a hard one! Hence my avoidance. BUT. No more dodging it. Here’s our INTRODUCTORY stab at […]
item.content:encoded:
Am I Ready For Sex?

by Erika Moen on 10/31/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • How To »
  • Sex & Sexuality

Haha, oh jeez, I’ve been avoiding this comic since we launched four years ago. “How do I know if I’m ready for sex?” (and variations of that question) is one of our most frequently requested topics and it’s… it’s a hard one! Hence my avoidance. BUT. No more dodging it. Here’s our INTRODUCTORY stab at this subject. Matt and I tried our best, but there’s no way we could possibly cover every single thing you’ll want to consider, which is why we REALLY recommend you read up some more at the links below and keep asking yourself questions, see where it takes you. Sex is a personal world of continued self-discovery, you’re always going to be learning and evolving over time. And, SUPER IMPORTANT: SEX IS SO MUCH MORE THAN A PENIS GOING IN A VAGINA. Phew, ok, now you should go read the rest of these links…

Am I Ready for Sex? – Planned Parenthood
Ready or Not? The Scarleteen Sex Readiness Checklist – Scarleteen
I don’t feel ready for sex at all: should I? – Scarleteen
I’m 13 and Totally Sure I’m Ready for Sex – Scarleteen

Since this IS a wordy comic, I’m going to bullet point the core questions we recommend you ask yourself, just so you have a short go-to list here in the blog:
Ask yourself:
– WHY do I want to have sex?
– WHAT am I comfortable doing?
– HOW will it impact my life, those around me, and myself as a person.

AND finally, it’s worth TRIPLE saying here again:
Sex is supposed to be a positive, intimate activity for everyone involved. If anything ever feels contrary to that, stop and reassess!

└ Tags: am I ready for sex?, first time, HOW will it impact my life?, Impact, personal, questions, ready, support, viginity, virgin, what am I comfortable trying?, why do I want to have sex?, you

Binders by Jey Pawlik

by Matthew Nolan on 10/03/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Guest Reviews »
  • Health »

We’re super excited to finally have a comic on binders! These things are important, transformative and powerful, we’ve wanted to have a comic on them for years, but don’t have enough personal experience with them at all. Thankfully, awesome Jey has stepped up and gotten us this great introduction, we hope it’s helpful for all of you looking to start binding!

Go say hi to Jey! Check out their webcomic and maybe drop them a buck or two on Patreon. I know they’re planning on selling the originals to this comic too at some point, so if you’re keen, follow them on Twitter too! Jey also asked that we drop this handy link to the Binding Health Project survey

item.content:encoded:
Some Thin Condoms

by Matthew Nolan on 09/19/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Couples Toys »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

Short and light little comic this week, as Erika and I prep to do some travel prep – I try my best to go back and see family every year when we can afford it!

Ok, so, I didn’t go in-depth on these condoms and I haven’t tried everything out there. The thing is, finding the right condom for YOU is a very personal thing. So much needs to be taken into account – your physical attributes, how you want it to look or feel, whether you want it to help or slow down your ejaculation and whatever else might be important. I wasn’t looking to make a be-all and end-all list of condoms here. Just show you what I’ve been trying recently and which ones have been making the cut into my personal condom box. If you’re on the hunt for YOUR condom – go ahead and give yourself permission to buy a bunch and sample them!

item.content:encoded:
Manual Sex

by Erika Moen on 09/12/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Health »
  • How To

The subject of Manual Sex is quite the handful! With our limited space, Matt and I could only provide the briefest introduction to the various methods and protections you can employ, but don’t worry: You can dive so much deeper following the links below. The keen observer will note that a good number of them go to Scarleteen. If you find this information useful or you just generally want to support comprehensive sex education, throw ‘em a buck or two, dude.

What “Counts” As Sex?


Ok, so first up, here are some resources on what “counts” as sex, what you can expect, what you can catch, and how to protect yourself as much as possible.

Oral sex, manual sex, anal sex…what’s it all mean, jellybean? on Scarleteen

What the heck does “sexually active” mean? on Scarleteen

Why does getting fingered feel better than sex? on Scarleteen

Manual Sex Safety


How To: Have Safe Manual Sex on The Condom Depot

How To: Safe Manual Sex on Spicy Gear Blog

Safely Doing Manual Sex on Scarleteen
I didn’t feel a thing with fingering: is there something wrong with me? on Scarleteen

Fingering (for vulvas)


How To Touch A Woman & Finger Her Vagina, In 8 Beginner Steps on Bustle

How To Finger A Woman To Make Her Orgasm With JUST Your Hands on Your Tango

Fingering (for butts)


(Video!) This Is How You Finger A Man’s Butt by DaveyWaveyRaw

The Beginner’s Guide to Butt Play on LifeHacker

12 Anal Foreplay Tips for Beginners on Cosmopolitan

Butt Fingering 101 on Persephone Magazine

Fisting


(Video!) Jiz Lee on Fisting Tips by Sex is Back

Fisting Day by Jiz Lee

Queer Porn meets Sex Ed in CrashPad’s Guide to Fisting on CrashPad

A Complete Beginner’s Guide to Fisting on Cosmopolitan

Anal Fisting – Learning the Basics on Deviance and Desire

Handjob


The 10 Best Hand Job Tips To Remember Next Time You Want To Take Him For A Ride on Bustle

How To Give A Good Hand Job, According To A Man on Bustle

item.title: Sponsorship
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: My Dearest Perverts, Matt and I have some pretty big news to share. Through the sponsorship of Planned Parenthood Columbia Willamette and The Magic Wand, Oh Joy Sex Toy is now ad free. I know, right?! So what brought this about? At the start of 2017 we had a bit of a realization. Oh Joy […]
item.content:encoded:
Sponsorship

by Erika Moen on 09/11/2017 at 3:32 pm
Posted In: Blog




My Dearest Perverts,

Matt and I have some pretty big news to share. Through the sponsorship of Planned Parenthood Columbia Willamette and The Magic Wand, Oh Joy Sex Toy is now ad free.

I know, right?!

So what brought this about?

At the start of 2017 we had a bit of a realization. Oh Joy Sex Toy turned 4 years old and what had started as a bit of a fun sex education and sex toy reviewing experiment has since grown into something bigger. I guess we were too busy making comics to really notice it happening, but in a blink of an eye our sex education comics numbered in the 100s and our humble experiment had become something of a real community resource.

With this revelation, we knew we had to update the face of our site. All these years we’ve used NSFW ads to help pay for what we do. We’ve always been fond of our naughty ads and felt they matched what we were doing early on. But it doesn’t fit anymore.

Nowadays Planned Parenthood coordinators send their volunteers to our site for sex ed crash courses, our monthly page views are in the multi-millions, we’re being used in doctors’ and gynecologists’ offices as a first glance resource, freshers at universities are being directed to our site and given print outs of our comics, our books are in libraries, and our comics have even shown up in the Tate Modern.

It’s time the face of Oh Joy Sex Toy reflects the fact that we now are a public education resource and one of the ways we are doing that is by removing ads to make the site feel friendlier and more accessible – something we can’t do without the help of sponsors.

On a personal note, getting both Planned Parenthood and The Magic Wand as our inaugural sponsors is honestly really meaningful to me because these two entities have done so much good in my life as a human being who was learning about my body and how to take care of it.

Planned Parenthood kept me safe and healthy when I had no health insurance in my early 20s by giving me a subsidized IUD. Their generosity and care enabled me to pursue my career and passions. I’ve volunteered for them and I’ve raised thousands of dollars for them through art fundraisers my friends and I have held online. And, of course, both Matt and I use their website as an indispensable resource when we’re researching information for our sex education comics. Haha, so it’s pretty fitting they’re sponsoring us, since we’re just illustrating their educational information anyway!

And The Magic Wand, oh my gosh. Our very first review on the site was of the Magic Wand because it was such a life changing toy for me. And I mean that! The Magic Wand taught me so much about my body and what it’s capable of. There’s a reason why it’s a revered classic of the sex toy world for since the 1970s! This guy, and its subsequent upgraded versions, have brought so much joy into Matt’s and my life.

To have both of these folks be our initial sponsors supporting the site when they’ve already supported and done so much for me as an individual person, well, it’s just pretty special for me. Haha, I know we all hear about “sponsorship” in the media and it sounds so corporate and impersonal, but for me this is very personal and very meaningful because of the role they’ve both actively played in my life before this point. I’m grateful for the support they’ve given me as a person learning how my body works and how to take care of it and how to bring it joy, and now Matt and I are honored to have their support of our work so we can help others learn about their bodies too.

Enjoy your new ad-free site, friends! And you can learn more about our sponsorship here.
—Erika

└ Tags: magic wand, planned parenthood, sponsor, sponsored, sponsorship
